DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
DASH_Sim_core.py

1 '''!
2 @brief This file contains the simulation core that handles the simulation events.
3 '''
4 import sys
5 import numpy as np
6 
7 import common # The common parameters used in DASH-Sim are defined in common_parameters.py
8 import DTPM
9 import DTPM_policies
10 
11 # Define the core of the simulation engine
12 # This function calls the scheduler, starts/interrupts the tasks,
13 # and manages collection of all the statistics
14 
15 class SimulationManager:
16  '''!
17  Define the SimulationManager class to handle the simulation events.
18  '''
19  def __init__(self, env, sim_done, job_gen, scheduler, PE_list, jobs, resource_matrix):
20  '''!
21  @param env: Pointer to the current simulation environment
22  @param sim_done: Simpy event object to indicate whether the simulation must be finished
23  @param job_gen: JobGenerator object
24  @param scheduler: Pointer to the DASH_scheduler
25  @param PE_list: The PEs available in the current SoC
26  @param jobs: The list of all jobs given to DASH-Sim
27  @param resource_matrix: The data structure that defines power/performance characteristics of the PEs for each supported task
28  '''
29  self.env = env
30  self.sim_done = sim_done
31  self.job_gen = job_gen
32  self.scheduler = scheduler
33  self.PEs = PE_list
34  self.jobs = jobs
35  self.resource_matrix = resource_matrix
36 
37  self.action = env.process(self.run()) # starts the run() method as a SimPy process
38 
39 
40 
41  def update_ready_queue(self,completed_task):
42  '''!
43  This function updates the common.TaskQueues.ready after one task is completed.
44 
45  As the simulation proceeds, tasks are being processed.
46  We need to update the ready tasks queue after completion of each task.
47 
48  @param completed_task: Object for the task that just completed execution
49  '''
50 
51  # completed_task is the task whose processing is just completed
52  # Add completed task to the completed tasks queue
53  common.TaskQueues.completed.list.append(completed_task)
54 
55  # Remove the completed task from the queue of the PE
56  for task in self.PEs[completed_task.PE_ID].queue:
57  if task.ID == completed_task.ID:
58  self.PEs[task.PE_ID].queue.remove(task)
59 
60  # Remove the completed task from the currently running queue
61  common.TaskQueues.running.list.remove(completed_task)
62 
63  # Remove the completed task from the current DAG representation
64  if completed_task.ID in common.current_dag:
65  common.current_dag.remove_node(completed_task.ID)
66 
67  # Initialize $remove_from_outstanding_queue which will populate tasks
68  # to be removed from the outstanding queue
69  remove_from_outstanding_queue = []
70 
71  # Initialize $to_memory_comm_time which will be communication time to
72  # memory for data from a predecessor task to a outstanding task
73  to_memory_comm_time = -1
74 
75  job_ID = -1
76  for ind, job in enumerate(self.jobs.list):
77  if job.name == completed_task.jobname:
78  job_ID = ind
79 
80 
81  # Check if the dependency of any outstanding task is cleared
82  # We need to move them to the ready queue
83  for i, outstanding_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.outstanding.list): # Go over each outstanding task
84  if (completed_task.ID in outstanding_task.predecessors): # if the completed task is one of the predecessors
85  outstanding_task.predecessors.remove(completed_task.ID) # Clear this predecessor
86 
87  if (common.shared_memory):
88  # Get the communication time to memory for data from a
89  # predecessor task to a outstanding task
90  comm_vol = self.jobs.list[job_ID].comm_vol[completed_task.base_ID , outstanding_task.base_ID]
91  comm_band = common.ResourceManager.comm_band[completed_task.PE_ID, self.resource_matrix.list[-1].ID]
92  to_memory_comm_time = int(comm_vol/comm_band) # Communication time from a PE to memory
93 
94  if (common.DEBUG_SIM):
95  print('[D] Time %d: Data from task %d for task %d will be sent to memory in %d us'
96  %(self.env.now, completed_task.ID, outstanding_task.ID, to_memory_comm_time))
97 
98  # Based on this communication time, this outstanding task
99  # will be added to the ready queue. That is why, keep track of
100  # all communication times required for a task in the list
101  # $ready_wait_times
102  outstanding_task.ready_wait_times.append(to_memory_comm_time + self.env.now)
103  # end of if (common.shared_memory):
104  # end of if (completed_task.ID in outstanding_task.predecessors):
105 
106  no_predecessors = (len(outstanding_task.predecessors) == 0) # Check if this was the last dependency
107  currently_running = (outstanding_task in # if the task is in the running queue,
108  common.TaskQueues.running.list) # We should not put it back to the ready queue
109  not_in_ready_queue = not(outstanding_task in # If this task is already in the ready queue,
110  common.TaskQueues.ready.list) # We should not append another copy
111 
112  if (no_predecessors and not(currently_running) and not_in_ready_queue):
113  if (common.PE_to_PE): # if PE to PE communication is utilized
114  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.append(common.TaskQueues.outstanding.list[i]) # Add the task to the ready queue immediately
115 
116  elif (common.shared_memory):
117  # if shared memory is utilized for communication, then
118  # the outstanding task will wait for a certain amount time
119  # (till the $time_stamp)for being added into the ready queue
120  common.TaskQueues.wait_ready.list.append(outstanding_task)
121  if (common.INFO_SIM) and (common.shared_memory):
122  print('[I] Time %d: Task %d ready times due to memory communication of its predecessors are'
123  %(self.env.now, outstanding_task.ID))
124  print('%12s'%(''), outstanding_task.ready_wait_times)
125  common.TaskQueues.wait_ready.list[-1].time_stamp = max(outstanding_task.ready_wait_times)
126 
127  remove_from_outstanding_queue.append(outstanding_task)
128  # end of for i, outstanding_task in...
129 
130  # Remove the tasks from outstanding queue that have been moved to ready queue
131  for task in remove_from_outstanding_queue:
132  common.TaskQueues.outstanding.list.remove(task)
133 
134  # At the end of this function:
135  # Newly processed $completed_task is added to the completed tasks
136  # outstanding tasks with no dependencies are added to the ready queue
137  # based on the communication mode and then, they are removed from
138  # the outstanding queue
139  #end def update_ready_queue(completed_task)
140 
141  def update_execution_queue(self, ready_list):
142  '''!
143  This function updates the common.TaskQueues.executable if one task is ready
144  for execution but waiting for the communication time, either between
145  memory and a PE, or between two PEs (based on the communication mode)
146 
147  @param ready_list: List of tasks that are ready to be executed
148  '''
149  # Initialize $remove_from_ready_queue which will populate tasks
150  # to be removed from the outstanding queue
151  remove_from_ready_queue = []
152 
153  # Initialize $from_memory_comm_time which will be communication time
154  # for data from memory to a PE
155  from_memory_comm_time = -1
156 
157  # Initialize $PE_to_PE_comm_time which will be communication time
158  # for data from a PE to another PE
159  PE_to_PE_comm_time = -1
160 
161  job_ID = -1
162  for ready_task in ready_list:
163  # If other communication modes are used (PE_to_PE or shared_memory)
164  for ind, job in enumerate(self.jobs.list):
165  if job.name == ready_task.jobname:
166  job_ID = ind
167 
168  for i, task in enumerate(self.jobs.list[job_ID].task_list):
169  if ready_task.base_ID == task.ID:
170  if ready_task.head == True:
171  # if a task is the leading task of a job
172  # then it can start immediately since it has no predecessor
173  ready_task.PE_to_PE_wait_time.append(self.env.now)
174  ready_task.execution_wait_times.append(self.env.now)
175  # end of if ready_task.head == True:
176 
177  for predecessor in task.predecessors:
178  if(task.ID==ready_task.ID):
179  ready_task.predecessors = task.predecessors
180 
181  # data required from the predecessor for $ready_task
182  comm_vol = self.jobs.list[job_ID].comm_vol[predecessor, ready_task.base_ID]
183 
184  # retrieve the real ID of the predecessor based on the job ID
185  real_predecessor_ID = predecessor + ready_task.ID - ready_task.base_ID
186 
187  # Initialize following two variables which will be used if
188  # PE to PE communication is utilized
189  predecessor_PE_ID = -1
190  predecessor_finish_time = -1
191 
192  if (common.PE_to_PE):
193  # Compute the PE to PE communication time
194  for completed in common.TaskQueues.completed.list:
195  if completed.ID == real_predecessor_ID:
196  predecessor_PE_ID = completed.PE_ID
197  predecessor_finish_time = completed.finish_time
198  comm_band = common.ResourceManager.comm_band[predecessor_PE_ID, ready_task.PE_ID]
199  PE_to_PE_comm_time = int(comm_vol/comm_band)
200  ready_task.PE_to_PE_wait_time.append(PE_to_PE_comm_time + predecessor_finish_time)
201 
202  if (common.DEBUG_SIM):
203  print('[D] Time %d: Data transfer from PE-%s to PE-%s for task %d from task %d is completed at %d us'
204  %(self.env.now, predecessor_PE_ID, ready_task.PE_ID,
205  ready_task.ID, real_predecessor_ID, ready_task.PE_to_PE_wait_time[-1]))
206  # end of if (common.PE_to_PE):
207 
208  if (common.shared_memory):
209  # Compute the memory to PE communication time
210  comm_band = common.ResourceManager.comm_band[self.resource_matrix.list[-1].ID, ready_task.PE_ID]
211  from_memory_comm_time = int(comm_vol/comm_band)
212  if (common.DEBUG_SIM):
213  print('[D] Time %d: Data from memory for task %d from task %d will be sent to PE-%s in %d us'
214  %(self.env.now, ready_task.ID, real_predecessor_ID, ready_task.PE_ID, from_memory_comm_time))
215  ready_task.execution_wait_times.append(from_memory_comm_time + self.env.now)
216  # end of if (common.shared_memory)
217  # end of for predecessor in task.predecessors:
218 
219  if (common.INFO_SIM) and (common.PE_to_PE):
220  print('[I] Time %d: Task %d execution ready times due to communication between PEs are'
221  %(self.env.now, ready_task.ID))
222  print('%12s'%(''), ready_task.PE_to_PE_wait_time)
223 
224  if (common.INFO_SIM) and (common.shared_memory):
225  print('[I] Time %d: Task %d execution ready time(s) due to communication between memory and PE-%s are'
226  %(self.env.now, ready_task.ID, ready_task.PE_ID))
227  print('%12s'%(''), ready_task.execution_wait_times)
228 
229  # Populate all ready tasks in executable with a time stamp
230  # which will show when a task is ready for execution
231  common.TaskQueues.executable.list.append(ready_task)
232  remove_from_ready_queue.append(ready_task)
233  if (common.PE_to_PE):
234  common.TaskQueues.executable.list[-1].time_stamp = max(ready_task.PE_to_PE_wait_time)
235  else:
236  common.TaskQueues.executable.list[-1].time_stamp = max(ready_task.execution_wait_times)
237  # end of ready_task.base_ID == task.ID:
238  # end of i, task in enumerate(self.jobs.list[job_ID].task_list):
239  # end of for ready_task in ready_list:
240 
241  # Remove the tasks from ready queue that have been moved to executable queue
242  for task in remove_from_ready_queue:
243  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.remove(task)
244 
245  common.TaskQueues.executable.list.sort(key=lambda task: task.jobID, reverse=False)
246 
247  def update_completed_queue(self):
248  '''!
249  This function updates the common.TaskQueues.completed
250  '''
251 
253  common.TaskQueues.completed.list.sort(key=lambda x: x.jobID, reverse=False)
254 
255  first_task_jobID = common.TaskQueues.completed.list[0].jobID
256  last_task_jobID = common.TaskQueues.completed.list[-1].jobID
257 
258  if ((last_task_jobID - first_task_jobID) > 15):
259  for i,task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.completed.list):
260  if (task.jobID == first_task_jobID):
261  del common.TaskQueues.completed.list[i]
262 
263 
264  #
265  def run(self):
266  '''!
267  Implement the basic run method that will be called periodically in each simulation "tick".
268 
269  This function takes the next ready tasks and run on the specific PE and update the common.TaskQueues.ready list accordingly.
270  '''
271  DTPM_module = DTPM.DTPMmodule(self.env, self.resource_matrix, self.PEs)
272 
273  for cluster in common.ClusterManager.cluster_list:
274  DTPM_policies.initialize_frequency(cluster)
275 
276  while (True): # Continue till the end of the simulation
277 
278  if self.env.now % common.sampling_rate == 0:
279  #common.results.job_counter_list.append(common.results.job_counter)
280  #common.results.sampling_rate_list.append(self.env.now)
281  # Evaluate idle PEs, busy PEs will be updated and evaluated from the PE class
282  DTPM_module.evaluate_idle_PEs()
283  # end of if self.env.now % common.sampling_rate == 0:
284 
285  if (common.shared_memory):
286  # this section is activated only if shared memory is used
287 
288  # Initialize $remove_from_wait_ready which will populate tasks
289  # to be removed from the wait ready queue
290  remove_from_wait_ready = []
291 
292  for i, waiting_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.wait_ready.list):
293  if waiting_task.time_stamp <= self.env.now:
294  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.append(waiting_task)
295  remove_from_wait_ready.append(waiting_task)
296  # at the end of this loop, all the waiting tasks with a time stamp
297  # equal or smaller than the simulation time will be added to
298  # the ready queue list
299  #end of for i, waiting_task in...
300 
301  # Remove the tasks from wait ready queue that have been moved to ready queue
302  for task in remove_from_wait_ready:
303  common.TaskQueues.wait_ready.list.remove(task)
304  # end of if (common.shared_memory):
305 
306  if (common.INFO_SIM) and len(common.TaskQueues.ready.list) > 0:
307  print('[I] Time %s: DASH-Sim ticks with %d task ready for being assigned to a PE'
308  % (self.env.now, len(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)))
309 
310  if (not len(common.TaskQueues.ready.list) == 0):
311  # give all tasks in ready_list to the chosen scheduler
312  # and scheduler will assign the tasks to a PE
313  if self.scheduler.name == 'CPU_only':
314  self.scheduler.CPU_only(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
315  elif self.scheduler.name == 'MET':
316  self.scheduler.MET(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
317  elif self.scheduler.name == 'EFT':
318  self.scheduler.EFT(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
319  elif self.scheduler.name == 'STF':
320  self.scheduler.STF(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
321  elif self.scheduler.name == 'ETF':
322  self.scheduler.ETF(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
323  elif self.scheduler.name == 'ETF_LB':
324  self.scheduler.ETF_LB(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
325  elif self.scheduler.name == 'CP':
326  self.scheduler.CP(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)
327  else:
328  print('[E] Could not find the requested scheduler')
329  print('[E] Please check "config_file.ini" and enter a proper name')
330  print('[E] or check "scheduler.py" if the scheduler exist')
331  sys.exit()
332  # end of if self.scheduler.name
333 
334 
335  self.update_execution_queue(common.TaskQueues.ready.list) # Update the execution queue based on task's info
336  # end of if not len(common.TaskQueues.ready.list) == 0:
337 
338  # Initialize $remove_from_executable which will populate tasks
339  # to be removed from the executable queue
340  remove_from_executable = []
341 
342  # Go over each task in the executable queue
343  if len(common.TaskQueues.executable.list) != 0:
344 
345  # for PE blocking data collection
346  if self.env.now >= common.warmup_period:
347  for PE in self.PEs:
348  a_list = []
349  if not PE.idle:
350  for k, executable_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.executable.list):
351  if executable_task.PE_ID == PE.ID:
352  if executable_task.time_stamp <= self.env.now:
353  a_list.append(executable_task)
354 
355  if len(a_list) > 0:
356  PE.blocking += 1
357 
358  for i, executable_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.executable.list):
359  is_time_to_execute = (executable_task.time_stamp <= self.env.now)
360  PE_has_capacity = (len(self.PEs[executable_task.PE_ID].queue) < self.PEs[executable_task.PE_ID].capacity)
361  task_has_assignment = (executable_task.PE_ID != -1)
362 
363  dynamic_dependencies_met = True
364 
365  dependencies_completed = []
366  for dynamic_dependency in executable_task.dynamic_dependencies:
367  dependencies_completed = dependencies_completed + list(filter(lambda completed_task: completed_task.ID == dynamic_dependency, common.TaskQueues.completed.list))
368  if len(dependencies_completed) != len(executable_task.dynamic_dependencies):
369  dynamic_dependencies_met = False
370 
371  if is_time_to_execute and PE_has_capacity and dynamic_dependencies_met and task_has_assignment:
372  self.PEs[executable_task.PE_ID].queue.append(executable_task)
373 
374  if (common.INFO_SIM):
375  print('[I] Time %s: Task %s is ready for execution by PE-%s'
376  % (self.env.now, executable_task.ID, executable_task.PE_ID))
377 
378  current_resource = self.resource_matrix.list[executable_task.PE_ID]
379  self.env.process(self.PEs[executable_task.PE_ID].run( # Send the current task and a handle for this simulation manager (self)
380  self, executable_task, current_resource, DTPM_module)) # This handle is used by the PE to call the update_ready_queue function
381 
382  remove_from_executable.append(executable_task)
383  # end of if is_time_to_execute and PE_has_capacity and dynamic_dependencies_met
384  # end of for i, executable_task in...
385  # end of if not len(common.TaskQueues.executable.list) == 0:
386 
387  # Remove the tasks from executable queue that have been executed by a resource
388  for task in remove_from_executable:
389  common.TaskQueues.executable.list.remove(task)
390 
391  # If DRL scheduler is active, tha tasks waiting in the exectuable queue will be redirected to the ready queue
392  if (len(common.TaskQueues.executable.list)):
393  if (self.scheduler.name == 'DRL'):
394  #print('ILP' in self.scheduler.name)
395  while len(common.TaskQueues.executable.list) > 0:
396  task = common.TaskQueues.executable.list.pop(-1)
397  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.append(task)
398 
399  # The simulation tick is completed. Wait till the next interval
400  yield self.env.timeout(common.simulation_clk)
401 
402  if self.env.now > common.simulation_length and common.inject_fixed_num_jobs is False:
403  self.sim_done.succeed()
404  #end while (True)

The DTPM module is responsible for evaluating the PE utilization and changing the V/f according to th...
